snippet: The chief executive of a Brooklyn hospital told Chirlane McCray, Mr. de Blasio’s spouse, that she had no job open at the moment, but that she could invent one.
abstract: New York City mayoral candidate Bill de Blasio introduced wife Chirlane McCray to head of Maimonides Medical Center in 2005, when McCray was searching for new job; hospital, which did not have job open, created one instead; de Blasio advocated for millions of dollars in funding for Maimonides during his eight years on City Council; Center official says creation of position for desirable recruit is not uncommon practice and was unrelated to de Blasio's position.

byline.original: By ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS and KATE TAYLOR

lead_paragraph: The chief executive of a Brooklyn hospital told Chirlane McCray, Mr. de Blasio’s spouse, that she had no job open at the moment, but that she could invent one.

headline.main: After an Introduction by de Blasio, a Brooklyn Hospital Hired His Wife
headline.print_headline: After an Introduction by de Blasio, a Brooklyn Hospital Hired His Wife
